item.title: Apple Re-hires Encryption Specialist Jon Callas
item.description:
Apple Re-hires Encryption Specialist Jon Callas

Apple seems to be banking on one of their former employees to bring additional security and encryption to their ecosystem. Jon Callas, who worked for the company twice in the past, was recently rehired, although it remains unclear as to what role at Apple will be going forward.

item.title: Japan Enacts Regulation for Digital Currency Exchanges - CoinDesk
item.description:
Japan Enacts Regulation for Digital Currency Exchanges - CoinDesk

The upper house of Japan's national legislature approved a bill on Wednesday to regulate domestic digital currency exchanges, a move that comes nearly two years after discussions about how to regulate the technology first began.

item.title: BTCS Expands Ethereum Hosting Business
item.description:
BTCS Expands Ethereum Hosting Business

Content : Arlington, VA - (Marketwired - ) - BTCS Inc. (OTCQB: BTCS) ("BTCS" or the "Company"), a blockchain technology focused company which secures the blockchain through its transaction verification services business, increased its Ethereum-mining hosting business to approximately 150 kilowatts ("kw"), up from approximately 50kw announced in March 2016.

item.title: Bitcoin Price Analysis: 5/25/2016
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Analysis: 5/25/2016

Bitcoin's price is moving along at least a medium-term upward wave. That short movement has a chance of growing into a long-term upward trend. The structure of the upward trend remains intact, and the movement has a potential for further growth as a consequence.

item.title: Blockchain application - where to begin?
item.description:
Blockchain application - where to begin?

I'm trying to figure out how to create something "applied blockchain" - most examples seem too high-level and hypothetical. Maybe a "bitcoin trading app"? Not sure where to start really. A book? I work with: *Micro/Mini Forex and Automated Trading Systems. *Market data systems, display, and ma...

item.title: Ethereum is the Forefront of Digital Currency - Stories From Coinbase
item.description:
Ethereum is the Forefront of Digital Currency - Stories From Coinbase

We have sat here for the last 3 years seeing only infrastructure apps like wallets and exchanges emerge on top of Bitcoin. Why is that? My theory has been that the scripting language in Bitcoin - the piece of every Bitcoin transaction that lets you run a little software program along with it - is too restrictive.

item.title: Are there any Blockchain-as-a-Service platform providing immutable data storage for people who do not want to build their own blockchains?
item.description:

item.title: Custom receive payments method?
item.description:
Custom receive payments method?

So it's a known problem that blockchain.info's api only allows a gap of 20 unpaid addresses, which sucks and makes their api almost completely worthless. But I was thinking how could I make my own

item.title: HERMICITY Releases Technical 'Rainbow' Paper
item.description:
HERMICITY Releases Technical 'Rainbow' Paper

Hermicity is a new project under Ethereum ecosystem that will allow people to pay for the delivery of supplies to homes in remote areas using Blockchain technology and drones. The project is being developed by an 18 years old Australian programmer.
